conclusion: Consider principles of shadow formation and geometry to determine shadow changes.
Shadows A, B, C, and D are cast to the left of the objects.
The light source is to the left of the objects.
Movement of light source to the right changes direction of light rays, affecting shadow position and size.
Shadows will shift to the left as light source moves to the right.
Shadow size depends on angle of light rays; can become longer or shorter.
If light source moves closer, shadows become larger; if further, shadows become smaller.
Shadows A, B, C, and D will move to the left and change size based on light source position.
